name: concocted

past simple and past participle of
concoct
to make something, usually food, by adding several different parts together, often in a way that is original or not planned: He concocted the most amazing dish from all sorts of leftover food.
to invent an excuse, explanation, or story in order to deceive someone: He concocted a story about working late at the office.
